title: Vault Index Generation Issue Resolution
details:
**Issue**: When running `na vault generate-index` command, all folders were being skipped.

**Root Cause**: The folders already contained index files (directory-named .md files), and the system was correctly skipping them because the --force flag was not used.

**Evidence from logs**: 
- Command: `na vault generate-index "C:\Users\danshue.REDMOND\Vault\01_Projects\MBA\Value Chain Management\Operations Management"`
- Log showed: "Skipping index file (already exists, use --force to overwrite)" for every folder
- System processed 100 folders: "0 processed, 100 skipped, 0 failed out of 100 total folders"

**Solution**: Add --force flag to regenerate existing index files:
`na vault generate-index "C:\Users\danshue.REDMOND\Vault\01_Projects\MBA\Value Chain Management\Operations Management" --force`

**Alternative Solutions**:
1. Use --dry-run first to preview what would be generated
2. Use --force to overwrite existing files
3. Delete existing index files first if you want to regenerate them from scratch

**System Behavior Confirmed Working**:
- Path resolution: ✓ Correct vault root detection
- Hierarchy calculation: ✓ Correctly calculating levels (3 for course, 4 for class, etc.)
- Template detection: ✓ Finding appropriate templates (course, class, module, etc.)
- File existence checking: ✓ Properly detecting existing index files
